thread.title: Adele Drops F-Bomb After Briefly Stopping George Michael Tribute, Still Delivers Powerful Performance
thread.title_full: Adele Drops F-Bomb After Briefly Stopping George Michael Tribute, Still Delivers Powerful Performance

author: Elisa Osegueda
title: Adele Drops F-Bomb After Briefly Stopping George Michael Tribute, Still Delivers Powerful Performance
text:
Adele Drops F-Bomb After Briefly Stopping George Michael Tribute, Still Delivers Powerful Performance by Elisa Osegueda 7:50   Photo: Getty Images Adele, once again, moved everyone to tears. 
The 28-year-old singer paid tribute to the late George Michael at Sunday's GRAMMY Awards with a powerful rendition of his 1996 song, "Fastlove." 
via GIPHY But near the beginning of performance, the "Hello" singer stopped and asked the show's producer to restart the song. "I know it's live TV. I f*cked up," she said. "I can't do it again like last year. I'm sorry for swearing. Can we please start it again? I'm sorry, I can't mess this up for him." Adele's tribute to George Michael at the #GRAMMYs 2017. pic.twitter.com/uDHL4wDyqf In an effort to show their support, The Recording Academy took to Twitter to cheer Adele on. "You got this, girl #GRAMMYs ," they wrote in one tweet. You got this, girl #GRAMMYs — Recording Academy (@RecordingAcad) February 13, 2017 "We love you, @adele!" they wrote in another post. We love you, @adele ! Standing ovation #GRAMMYs — Recording Academy (@RecordingAcad) February 13, 2017 For more on Adele's road to the GRAMMYs, watch the video below. RELATED SLIDESHOW
